info.title: TikAPI REST API
info.description:
# Introduction The TikAPI API is an unofficial API on top of TikTok application API. Our API is RESTful. It has predictable resource URLs. It uses HTTP response codes to indicate errors. It also accepts and returns JSON in the HTTP body. You can use your favorite HTTP/REST library for your programming language to use TikApi's API.

Check out this demo to see how OAuth works https://youtu.be/JDupJKZ0Yy8 # Postman You can easily test our API with Postman. Make sure you set `apiKey` & `accountKey` as environment variables. [![Run in Postman](https://run.pstmn.io/button.svg)](https://app.getpostman.com/run-collection/371f1e6742af51de0a06?action=collection%2Fimport) # SDK Check out our Javascript SDK at https://github.com/tikapi-io/tiktok-api # Errors You can identify errors from the HTTP Status code or response body. As with our normal API responses, your client must be prepared to gracefully handle additional members of the response. ## Bad Request (400) The request could not be understood by the server due to malformed syntax or parameters. The client should not repeat the request without modifications. #### Example ```json { "status": "error", "message": "Missing fields.", "fields": { "sec_user_id": "A valid TikTok user id is required." } } ``` ## Forbidden (403) These can occur for different reasons such as Unauthorized access, Invalid Credentials or API Key Rate Limit reached. #### Example ```json { "status": "error", "message":"Something went wrong." } ``` ## Not Found (404) The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI. No indication is given of whether the condition is temporary or permanent. #### Example ```json { "status": "error", "message": "The requested URL was not found on the server. If you entered the URL manually please check your spelling and try again." } ``` ## Method Not Allowed (405) The method specified in the Request-Line is not allowed for the resource identified by the Request-URI. #### Example ```json { "status": "error", "message": "The method is not allowed for the requested URL." } ``` # Authentication

tags.description: Endpoints that do not require a logged in user.

get.summary: Get information about your API Key

200.description: Key information was retrieved successfully

fields.X-ACCOUNT-KEY: The User authorization key is required.

get.description: Get profile information from username.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: This can also be a profile short link i.e `https://vm.tiktok.com/ZM8HoAm5o/`

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: You can optionally choose the proxy country from where the request is being sent by providing an ISO Code (i.e us, ca, gb).

200.description: User profile was retrieved successfully

parameters.name: country

get.description:
Get a list of posts using the hashtag ID or name.
**Note**: You can only get a full list of results by using the hashtag ID. You can find the ID by sending a request using the hashtag name.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description:
The hashtag ID `challenge_id`.
This can also be a short hashtag link i.e `https://vm.tiktok.com/ZM8HoyrHD/`

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The hashtag name. This is not required if you know the ID.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Number of items to be returned

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The starting number of items list

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: You can optionally choose the proxy country from where the request is being sent by providing an ISO Code (i.e us, ca, gb).

200.description: A list of items was retrieved successfully

desc.example: Reply to @astro29624 I don’t hear it at all but okay

get.description: Get a list of posts using the music ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description:
The music ID.
This can also be a short music link i.e `https://vm.tiktok.com/ZM8HoVDFE/`

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Number of items to be returned

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The starting number of items list

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: You can optionally choose the proxy country from where the request is being sent by providing an ISO Code (i.e us, ca, gb).

200.description: A list of items was retrieved successfully

signature.example: NBA ASH BOY 🔥 AKA Lil Ashy 🥶🥵

get.description: By including the `download` parameter this will return a mp4 file.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description:
The TikTok video ID.
This can also be a video short link i.e `https://vm.tiktok.com/ZM8Ho4Kfw/`

parameters.name: download
parameters.description: To dowload the TikTok video, set this to `1`

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: You can optionally choose the proxy country from where the request is being sent by providing an ISO Code (i.e us, ca, gb).

200.description: The video information was retrieved successfully

signature.example: i have all of the answers inside of my head

200.description: User profile has been modified successfully, returns current profile information.

x-code-samples.source:
curl --request POST \
  --url https://api.tikapi.io/user/edit \
  --header 'X-ACCOUNT-KEY: {YOUR_KEY_VALUE}' \
  --header 'X-API-KEY: {YOUR_KEY_VALUE}' \
  --header 'accept: application/json' \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --data '{"bio": "My new bio!"}'

post.description:
Make a comment or reply to a comment in a post. Including the `author_id` and `author_username` of the post is recommended.
*This endpoint is restricted. Learn more at https://helpdesk.tikapi.io/portal/en/kb/articles/how-can-i-get-access-to-special-endpoints*

reply_comment_id.description: You can reply to a comment by including a comment ID

200.description: Comment has been posted successfully

x-code-samples.source:
curl --request POST \
  --url https://api.tikapi.io/user/comment \
  --header 'X-ACCOUNT-KEY: {YOUR_KEY_VALUE}' \
  --header 'X-API-KEY: {YOUR_KEY_VALUE}' \
  --header 'accept: application/json' \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --data '{"media_id":6909572907798678790, "text":"Thats dope!", "author_id":6569595380449902597, "author_username":"lilyachty"}'

post.description: Likes a post comment. Including the post `author_id` and `author_username` is recommended.

200.description: Comment has been posted successfully

post.description: Unlike a post comment. Including the post `author_id` and `author_username` is recommended.

200.description: Comment has been posted successfully

200.description: Comment has been deleted

post.description:
**Premium**
Start a live video and get the stream settings for any user that has live enabled *(has at least 1,000 Followers)*. The live is closed automatically after stream ends.

third_party.description: Enable the third party (Use `0` for normal accounts)

200.description: Live video has started successfully

x-code-samples.source:
curl --request POST \
  --url https://api.tikapi.io/user/live/start \
  --header 'X-ACCOUNT-KEY: {YOUR_KEY_VALUE}' \
  --header 'X-API-KEY: {YOUR_KEY_VALUE}' \
  --header 'accept: application/json' \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --data '{"title": "Check out my live!"}'

post.description:
**Premium**
Stop a live video.

200.description: Live video has stopped

get.description:
Get information about a live video.
You can use this for any user that has an open live video. There is a `roomId` parameter included when fetching profile information about users.

parameters.name: room_id
parameters.description: The live room ID

200.description: Information about live video has been retrieved successfully

gift.example: Receiving LIVE gifts is turned off.

parameters.name: room_id

200.description: List of recommended live videos has been retrieved successfully

gift.example: Receiving LIVE gifts is turned off.

get.description: Get statistics for a live video, after it has ended.

parameters.name: room_id
parameters.description: The live room ID

200.description: Statistics for live video have been retrieved successfully

get.description: Enter a live video and get information if the video is open. Returns live status if video is not open.

parameters.name: room_id
parameters.description: The live room ID

200.description: Information about live video has been retrieved successfully

api_key.name: X-API-KEY
api_key.description: This is your TikApi API Key, must be included in header on every request.  You can refresh this key from TikApi Developer Dashboard. When sending an API request you must include this key in Headers with header name `X-API-KEY`.

account_key.description: The system of obtaining an users authorization key is based in OAuth 2.0 specification, with some differences. Here are the steps for getting an authorization key: #### 1. Ask an User for Authorization To get an access token, you need to ask an user to authorize your application. You can do this by sharing your OAuth link to the user or using the [TikAPI Login Button](https://github.com/tikapi-io/js-sdk). Example OAuth Link: `https://tikapi.io/account/authorize?client_id=c_1234567890&redirect_uri=https://tikapi.io/success&scope=view_profile%20search` - **client_id** required - This is your application id, you can find this on TikApi Developer Dashboard. - **redirect_uri** required - The user will be redirect here after successful authorization and the params `access_token`,`scope` will be passed in query. You must set your application redirect links on TikApi Developer Dashboard. - **scope** optional - A list of permissions seperated with space. User can choose to not allow some of these permission. - **state** optional - A custom state data to pass on. #### 2. Using Authorization After an user has authorized your application, a redirection will occur at your **specified redirection link** and the **query url parameters will include**: - `access_token` which is the user authorization key, - `scope` which is the list of allowed permissions, in case the user might have choosen to disallow some permissions. Also, you can see your current authorized users from your TikApi Developer Dashboard. The authorization key never expires, but user can choose to revoke access at anytime. When sending an API request you must include this key in **Headers** with header name `X-ACCOUNT-KEY`. | **Security Scheme Type** | User Authorization Key | |-----------------------|------------------------| | **Header parameter name** | X-ACCOUNT-KEY |

scopes.view_profile: To read a user's profile info and activity
scopes.media_actions: To like or comment videos on a user behalf
scopes.follow_actions: To follow or unfollow other users
scopes.search: To read any profile info and media

message.description: A short, human-readable summary of the success type.
